Articles.Content:
**KAS Revamp, maybe....?**

KAS is a great mod but the parts are a little past due and therefore I took the challenge to retexture and remodel the mod. Right now I have only done the two containers and they are far from done.

But I decided to show you guys my work to get feedback and suggestions and mostly to see if there is any interest ![:D](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_cheesy.gif)

The parts use the same .cfg as with the mod with some modifications. I tested it and they should work just like the orgininal ones. 

<iframe width="640" height="480" frameborder="0" allowfullscreen=""></iframe><iframe width="640" height="480" frameborder="0" allowfullscreen=""></iframe>

**Download**: [https://drive.google.com/open?id=0B-pq4KhmYle3M0xaYWlreVcxaGc&authuser=0](https://drive.google.com/open?id=0B-pq4KhmYle3M0xaYWlreVcxaGc&authuser=0)

Just install like any other part, it will automaticly be placed in the KAS/Parts folder. 

**Disclaimer:** I have had no contact with the original develeoper of this mod and therefor I take no credit for anything. Rright now this should be seen a addictonal parts and no replacement.

So like I said please leave some feedback and suggestions. Hopefully more parts are to come. ![:cool:](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_cool.gif)
You do realize that the containers of KAS are going to be depreciated, right?
Indeed, you need to look into Kerbal Inventory System
Please also make some nice looking inline containers.

> 
> You do realize that the containers of KAS are going to be depreciated, right?

> 
> Please also make some nice looking inline containers.

I see.... well that is a unexpected change. ![:sealed:](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_lipssealed.gif) This will require some brainstorming

> 
> Please also make some nice looking inline containers.

There is a mod with inline containers but I forgot the name. It was not made for KAS/KIS but you could put parts in it the normal way. But thanks for the feedback, I will look into that.

With inline storage, you're probably thinking of Universial Storage and the storage wedges.

Also, if you're interested in working on the models, you could get in touch with KospY and winn79.
Yes exactly! KIS could use plenty of help fleshing out their system with models/etc, so don't be discouraged, see if they want a hand!
